Sheet1.Name: Cambridge Warming Center
Sheet1.Address: Basement of the Cambridge Senior Center (Access is solely through the rear parking lot on Green Street), 806 Massachusetts Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139
Sheet1.Brief Description: Drop-in center on a first come first serve basis until capacity is reached. Provide beverages and a hot meal, access to bathrooms and shower, and the ability to rest on a yoga mat on the floor. Guests may talk with expert staff to get a referral to physical and mental health care, addiction treatment services and housing services. When the Center closes in the morning, all guests are offered a ride to a local daytime shelter.
Sheet1.Hours: 2022-2023 season, which runs December 1, 2022 through April 30, 2023, the Warming Center will be available from 7:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m. seven days a week

Sheet1.Name: Harvard Square Homeless Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Student-run overnight shelter that provides 24 homeless individuals at a time with a safe, clean, and caring place to stay during the winter months. In addition to temporary shelter, HSHS also provides counseling resources and a transitional program for guests who are employed and committed to saving money towards securing housing.
Sheet1.Hours: Overnight Shelter. Open from November 15th until April 15th; 7:30-8am lottery for 14-day beds; 9-9:30pm for single night beds, 11pm last call lottery for single night beds.
Sheet1.Qualifications: 18+, criminal record allowed, no substances allowed - dry shelter, has accessability

Sheet1.Name: Pine Street Inn Shelters - Men's Inn
Sheet1.Brief Description: Өelter is open 24/7/365 days a year and provides emergency shelter services to 206 guests each night. Guest Services Specialists create a welcoming atmosphere of respect while providing connections to critical services that help reduce lengths of homelessness and support each individual pathway to permanent housing.
Sheet1.Qualifications: Must identify/present as male, 18+, No ID required, criminal record allowed, substances allowed

Sheet1.Name: Pine Street Inn Shelters - Women’s Inn
Sheet1.Brief Description: Women’s Inn is open 24/7/365 and provides a safe, supportive, and welcoming environment for 81 guests each night. Staff members work with guests to create a pathway to permanent supportive housing, providing connections to critical services that help reduce the lengths of homelessness and support each individual in their housing goal.
Sheet1.Qualifications: Must identify/present as female, 18+, No ID required, criminal record allowed, substances allowed

Sheet1.Name: Pine Street Inn Shelters - Shattuck Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Open 24/7/365 and offers emergency shelter for 30 guests in support of theࠃity of Boston񳠥fforts to provide shelter, recovery services and a housing pathway for individuals who had been unsheltered in the Mass and Cass area. Also provides assistance for guests who are struggling with addiction, legal, financial, mental health and physical issues.

Sheet1.Name: Pine Street Inn Shelters - Holy Family Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Holy Family Inn provides a sober shelter environment for 47 guests each night. Guests are referred from other Pine Street Inn emergency shelters and programs and must be actively engaged in seeking housing.
Sheet1.Qualifications: This is a referral-only sober living shelter. Guests are referred from Pine Street񳠍en񳠉nn and Shattuck Shelter. All guests must be actively seeking housing.

Sheet1.Name: Southhampton St. Men's Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Beds are first come first serve. Offer breakfast (5:30am-6am), lunch (11pm), and dinner (4:30pm).

Sheet1.Name: Y2Y Harvard Square Youth Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Student-run overnight shelter that employs a youth-to-youth model to provide a safe and affirming environment for young adults 18-24 experiencing homelessness. Dinner and breakfast is provided to guests that have a bed at Y2Y. Case management services are also provided every night at Y2Y.
Sheet1.Hours: Overnight Shelter. Open from mid-June to mid-August and mid-October to mid-April. Lottery runs at 8:45AM each day.
Sheet1.Qualifications: 18-24, damp shelter - can be under the influence but no substances within the space, accessable

Sheet1.Name: MetroHousing Boston
Sheet1.Brief Description: Helps unhoused people in the Boston area find permament housing.

Sheet1.Name: Somerville Housing Coalition
Sheet1.Brief Description: Helps unhoused people in the Somerville Area find permanent housing
Sheet1.Qualifications: leave your name and number when you call

Sheet1.Name: Cambridge Multi-Service Center
Sheet1.Brief Description: Offers case management for referral to shelters and other services; also offers a transitional living program for men. For access to case management, walk-in hours are Monday: 9AM-7:30PM; Tuesday: 9AM-430PM; Friday: 9AM-1130AM.
Sheet1.Hours: Walk in hours: Monday 9AM-730PM; Tuesday-Thursday 9AM-430PM; Friday 9AM-1130AM

Sheet1.Name: Bridge Over Troubled Waters
Sheet1.Brief Description: For youth who need help, Bridge can provide more than just shelter and a warm meal. Bridge helps youths find pathways to education, mental health counseling, career development, transitional living solutions, community support, and more.

Sheet1.Name: Rosie's Place
Sheet1.Brief Description: Rosie's Place is a multi-service community center that offers women emergency shelter and meals, and so much more: a food pantry, ESOL classes, legal assistance, wellness care, one-on-one support, housing and job search services, and community outreach. Here women will find support, opportunity and the tools they need to make a new start.

Sheet1.Name: Heading Home Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: Leading provider of shelter in Boston: Heading Home currently owns and operates 10 properties that both house and serve clients. They offer congregate shelters and scattered shelters.

Sheet1.Name: Woods Mullen Shelter for Women
Sheet1.Brief Description: Located at 794 Massachusetts Avenue in Boston's South End. The shelter serves female adults ages 18 years or older. The shelter has 200 beds and is open 365 days a year, 24 hours a day. Beds are given out on a first-come, first-served basis. In the winter months, additional overflow beds are available.

Sheet1.Name: Saint Patrick Women's Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: St. Patrick’s Shelter is an emergency shelter for homeless women. Guests receive referrals for health care, mental health services, educational services, and housing. Women in need of shelter contact the shelter directly at 617-628-3015 to determine vacancy. Staff will welcome the women and provide an assessment for barriers to housing, creating an individualized treatment plan to self-sufficiency.

Sheet1.Name: First Church Shelter
Sheet1.Brief Description: The First Church Shelter accepts referrals from credible service providers in the greater Boston area, including hospitals, other shelters, and social service agencies. To qualify for the Shelter, you must be a male aged 18 years or older. We are not able to admit guests with active drug or alcohol dependency, or anyone who is experiencing an acute psychiatric emergency.
